definition: mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The three factors may affect one another, leading to sexual anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 三者可相互影响，互为因果，造成郁而不达。

sentences.english: The shift of educational functions and the reforms in higher education have double-way effects on each other.
sentences.chinese: 高等学校职能变化与高等教育的改革互为因果关系。

sentences.english: The content of fiction is inseparably interconnected with its form and structure.
sentences.chinese: 小说的内容和结构形态互为因果，不可分割。

sentences.english: The relationship of modern lease and economy flourish reflects mutual causality.
sentences.chinese: 现代租赁与经济发达是互为因果的。

sentences.english: Professional performance and attitude interact as both cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 护理专业行为表现和专业态度互为因果。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
to trace something to its source (idiom)
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
